data.title: Snippet Choice Ordering
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 x64
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a custom snippet with large number of choices. 

It should display the choices in the same order as they are in the choice list, but they're not.  It appears to break when there are 11 or more choices.  Below is an example of my snippet and a screenshot of the issue.

```
"addgroup": {
	"prefix": "addgroup",
	"body": [
		"addgroup \"${1:group}\" to ${2|NP0,NP1,NP2,NP3,NP4,NP5,NP6,NP7,NC0,NC1,NC2|}"
	]
}
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9040032/29983719-c7c904da-8f1c-11e7-8922-75933aca4db6.png)

Notice it goes NP0, NP1, then NC2, and back to NP2, etc.  NC2 should be last on the list.

- Extensions: Many


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a .code-workspace file in the editor
2. A warning is shown on the first character: `'Unable to parse content from 'vscode://schemas/workspaceConfig': Parse error at offset 0.' at: '1,1' source: ''`

data.title: Allow regular expression for CompletionItemProvider triggerCharacters
data.body:
**Problem**
For issues like #23962, we want to trigger suggestions when the user types the `'` in:

```js
import _ from '
```

Registering the TS completion provider with `'` as a trigger character currently results in the completion provider being shown too often and in unexpected placed

**Proposal**
Allow triggerCharacters to use regular expressions. This regular expression would be run against the proceeding text on the line. In the above case, the completion item provider would use a regular expression like `/from\s+['"]$/` and be run against: `import _ from '`

data.title: Does not open a local file from Windows Explorer
data.body:
**Setup:**
- OS Version: Windows 10, x64
- VS Code version:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7396135/29982406-4007d7ea-8f5a-11e7-96ed-7d6b00990926.png)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Double click a file in Windows Explorer (if VSCode is default program for that extension)
OR
1. Right click on a file > Open With > Visual Studio Code

**Reproduces without extensions:** Yes

**Notes:**
I noticed that **Computer\HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\vscode\shell\open\command** has this default value: 
`"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" --open-url "%1"`

So I tried removing `--open-url` and it works for the first time, because VSCode automatically updates the registry and adds `--open-url` again thus unfixing my fix :(

data.title: SCM viewlet does not remove deleted Git repo when deleting its folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (aa42e6ef8184e8ab20ddaa5682b861bfb6f0b2ad, 2017-09-01T15:25:57.896Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: Many

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start with an empty folder in a workspace
2. `mkdir subfolder; cd subfolder; git init; cd ..`
3. -> SCM viewlet shows Git repo
4. `rm -r subfolder`
5. -> SCM viewlet continues to show Git repo although it no longer exists

data.title: Removing nested folder from workspace removes contained Git repo from SCM viewlet
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (aa42e6ef8184e8ab20ddaa5682b861bfb6f0b2ad, 2017-09-01T15:25:57.896Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: Many

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open empty window
2. Add empty folder to workspace
3. `mkdir subfolder; cd subfolder; git init`
4. -> Git repo shown in SCM viewlet
5. Add subfolder as folder to workspace
6. Remove subfolder as folder from workspace
7. -> Git repo disappears from SCM viewlet

Not sure if asking for a microsoft account is a good idea though.

data.title: show lightbulb inline
data.body:
- [x] place lightbulb into the (usually) free space right of the line numbers, overflow top/bottom if the current line starts at a low offset
- [x] change the trigger logic to be just the selection, unless it is in whitespace only
- [x] change marker selection from range on exthost-side
- [x] keep the trigger logic to for markers if enclosed

data.title: Joh/lightbulb
Screen reader detected -> help user to turn tab to move focus
data.body:
Currently we automatically detect that a screen reader is detected, however we could at that moment also automatically swithc tab to move focus. 
If you think that is too aggressive we could at least do a message via message service
"We have detected you are using a screen reader, would you like to use tab to move focus"

1. ctrl-N to start a new file. I have default language to powershell

If I create a ps1 file in ISE and type Swedish letters there and then open the file in VSCode it works as it should!

Reproduces without extensions: Not done

data.title: Shortkeys - Add a "when clause" for "focus is in panel"
data.body:
Hi all, I'm using vscode (1.15.1) for a few days and I've a very good impression about it ! 
However, I'm writing a simple extension and playing with interactive js shell (debug console) and I missed a keyboard shortcut to jump between text editor and panel.
The solution given in [this StackOverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42796887/switch-focus-between-editor-and-integrated-terminal-in-visual-studio-code) is great for swapping between **integrated terminal** and code editor, but here I'm not using terminal, but debug console.

So I tried something very similar (using `ctrl+e` (but no matters)) and tried to add 2 rules like that :


    {
        "key": "ctrl+e",
        "command": "workbench.action.focusPanel",
        "when": "editorTextFocus"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+e",
        "command": "workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup",
        "when": "!editorTextFocus"
    }


But this doesn't work: I can focus from the text edition to the panel, but I can't focus back. I figured out after some tests that when the focus is in panel, `editorTextFocus` is still true (in contrary to `terminalFocus`).

So, to find a solution to my problem, I need a *when clause* that let me know whether the focus is on panel or not. As far as I can see in vscode'code, I can't find any `RawContextKey` that looks like that.

Did I missed something ? (I hope I didn't opened an issue for nothing)
Thanks !

data.title: Can't see what I'm writing in the Search Widget input field
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the search widget (cmd + F)

Expected Behaviour:

The input field has a reasonable width to see what I'm writing

Detected Behaviour:

The input field is a couple of pixel wide, and seeing what I'm writing is impossible.

Extra Notes:

I've experienced a regression in Version 1.15, since it has always been as expected before. I've also inspected the styles applied to the whole Search Widget, and it looks like the fixed width of 441px for the widget container is causing this issue.

Search widget as it looks on Version 1.15.1

![vscode_with_411px_costrain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25553165/29967492-1b536d58-8f17-11e7-89c0-c4b2576ba3db.png)

Search widget without 411px width costrain

![vscode_without_411px_costrain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25553165/29967493-1b556b80-8f17-11e7-9941-612057d4759b.png)



Reproduces without extensions: Yes
